definition: to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: Hours and hours I've spent pasting their bloody rot all over London.
sentences.chinese: 成天價在倫敦貼他們的那些死爛貨。

sentences.english: The gander circled the pond for days, and more days after that.
sentences.chinese: 那雄鵝成天圍着池塘轉，日復一日。

sentences.english: Getting an early start each day helped you get a lot more done, not just in the morning but throughout the day.
sentences.chinese: 每天夙興對你好處很多，不僅僅是早晨而是一成天。

sentences.english: You know how I hate people who bawl all the time.
sentences.chinese: 你知道我就看不慣那種成天嚷嚷嚷的人。

sentences.english: The guy is always a little trippy.
sentences.chinese: 那個傢伙成天迷迷糊糊的。

sentences.english: We have to speak French all day there. No English allowed!
sentences.chinese: 在那裏我們成天說法語，不準說英語。

sentences.english: You have been raking and smoking too much, you wicked boy.
sentences.chinese: 你成天胡鬧，吸菸吸得太多了，你這個淘氣的孩子。

sentences.english: She nagged at him all day long.
sentences.chinese: 她成天嘮嘮叨叨地找他岔子。

sentences.english: I make people happy all day with foreclosures.
sentences.chinese: 我成天都在取消按揭回贖權，這讓人們很高興。

sentences.english: It was all he would have allday and he knew that he should take it.
sentences.chinese: 這是他今兒一成天的飲食，他知道該當把它喝了。

sentences.english: Many worriers are gifted with imaginations.
sentences.chinese: 很多成天憂心忡忡的人天生富有想象力。

sentences.english: Do you think spending whole lot of time to wage a spit war with China is meaningful?
sentences.chinese: 你可有想過成天打中國的口水戰有意義嗎？

sentences.english: Don't keep the children inside all day.
sentences.chinese: 別把孩子們成天關在屋裏。

sentences.english: You think white people go around calling each other honkies all day, man?
sentences.chinese: 你什麼時候聽過白人成天互相稱呼“白鬼”？

sentences.english: The cowboy is blowing his flute all day long.
sentences.chinese: 牛背上牧童的短笛，這時候也成天嘹亮地響着。

sentences.english: She's always living out of a suitcase.
sentences.chinese: 她成天過着旅行包式的生活。

definition: to have nothing to do/to idle one's time away (idiom)
not to engage in honest work/to ignore one's proper occupation/not to attend to one's proper duties
lit. twice every three days (idiom); practically every day/frequently
day and night/regardless of the time of day or night
happy to partake but not prepared to do any work (idiom)/all take and no give
to set one's heart on sth (idiom)
to hang out together with (derog.)/to mix with
to spend one's time in drinking and pleasure (idiom); to indulge in sensual pleasures/life of debauchery
